result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott F Ufferman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notification of Filing of Circuit Court Record

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court.  Called 3:08 PM. FTR recorded. Ufferman asks for $100/month. Court due to total amount due needs a larger amount per month and imposes payment plan of $150/month commencing 1/16/17.
It is ordered that the time for transmitting the record is extended to 12/29/16
from COC to COA asking for extension for transmitting file to COA

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Habeck and his court reporter appear via video from Shawano County. Called at 9:41 AM. State - here for a motion filed by Attorney Kennedy to supplement the record/pagination. Kennedy agrees, asks the Court to allow the Clerk to supplement the record to add the exhibits that were offered at the jury trial but not received by the Court. Court reads statute in regards to this issue. State objects to the supplementation of the record for stated reasons and asks Court to deny the motion. Court asks Kennedy why they are relevant. Kennedy responds. State responds, does not believe the exhibits are relevant. Court asks question of both Kennedy and State in regards to how the statute reads and their interpretation of it. Kennedy responds. State responds. Court gives it's interpreation of the statute and makes ruling - aloows the exhibits to be made part of the record but wants to make it clear that the particular exhibits were not admitted by the Court. Kennedy is to prepare an Order with those instructions for signature. Adjourned at 9:51 AM.
Payment hearing on December 6, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
It is ordered that the time for transmitting the record is extended to December 5, 2016
Motion hearing on November 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
To Court of Appeal for Extension
From Clerk with Index for Court of Appeals Case attached.
It is ordered that the court official prepare the record in accordance with Rule 809.15(2) and (4) and file the record with this court within fifteen days of the date of this order.
from Attorndy Kennedy requesting DL be reinstated pending appeal

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Defendant Scott F Ufferman in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:35 PM. Court - here for motion for stay pending appeal. Kennedy states motion, asking for a stay of execution pending appeal although he only has about 12 days jail remaining to serve (if credit is figured correctly), record should be at COA within 20 days from today, asking for a stay on the fine owed, also asking for stay on DL revocation for stated reasons. Court puts on the record why this motion hearing was not heard as originally scheduled on 9/1/16. Court asking if Kennedy is asking for the withdrawal of the motion to stay the jail sentence. Kennedy responds, only has 12 days left to serve. State makes argument on the motion, but first wants to hear from the defendant if he is withdrawing his motion to stay the jail sentence. Ufferman leaves it as the discretion of the Court in regards to stay of the jail term. Defendant does indeed withdraw the motion for stay of jail sentence pending appeal. Court grants that request. State argues motion, not taking a position on the motion to stay the DL revocation but makes argument in regards to the stay of the fine assessed. State objects to the statement by defendant that they will win on the merits of the appeal. Kennedy responds, still requesting the stay of the payment of the fine, believes the DL revocation stay is automatic with DOT. Court asks if Kennedy is withdrawing the part of the motion for the stay of DL revocation. Kennedy agrees. Court will only hear the motion on the stay for the payment of the fine. Court makes decision - reviews the merits of the appeal - does not see a great chance that the defendant will win the appeal - denies the motion to stay the fine and the fine is to be paid within the statutory period. Kennedy asks about the assessment part of the DL revocation. Court - did not rule on that as Kennedy had previously withdrawn that. Kennedy makes statement in regards to class. Discussion on if Kennedy is asking the Court to rule on something else today. Kennedy will contact DOT in regards to that and if there is issues, it will contact the court. Court is adjourned at 2:50 PM.
Motion hearing on October 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of filing of reporter's transcripJune 30, 2016 jury trial
From Court of appeals regarding transcripts.
Motion hearing on September 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:30 AM, held in chambers. Court gives parties jury instructions to review. Parties will stipulate to two priors (THC). Off record at 8:32 AM for Kennedy and defendant to discuss the two priors. Back on record at 8:34 AM. Kennedy asks for sequestration - granted. Kennedy indicates his witness (MC) will not be needed and he has released her from her subpoena. Kennedy asks for redacted police report. State objects and has original police report which he will offer as an exhibit. Court will not take judicial notice of treatise of any expert witness for stated reasons as the expert is not here in person. Court will not allow any argument regarding medical use of THC. State motions standard. Much discussion on treatise, court denies #3, #4, #5, #@6 and #7 for stated reasons. State objects to all treatises for stated reasons 0 cites 904.03. Can use general principle in defense regarding defense exhibit #10. Jurors can take notes and ask questions. Much discussion on prior criminal convictions state believes 6 and defense argues all conviction are old and should not be allowed. Court allowing 6 priors and Mr. Ufferman agrees with that amount of prior criminal convictions. Court will use jury instructions foropening #50, #110, and 2664B and will use #100 at closing. Adjourned at 9:30 AM. Recalled at 9:40 AM, back in chambers, same appearances but court reporter is not present. State asks for alternate juror, Kennedy doesn't ask for alternate, Clerk Carter indicates her concerns, court will have alternate juror. Adjourned at 9:40 AM.

#1 - FOSO Incident #15-8619; #2 - FOF incident #15-8619; #3 - exerpt regarding stopping distances; #4 - Drug Evaluation and Classification Training booklet;  #5 - page 10 of Drug Evaluation and Classification Training booklet; #6 - page 9 of Drug Evaluation and Classification Training booklet; #7 - page 8 of Drug Evaluation and Classification Training booklet; #8 - Certification Form for Copies of original documents of Crandon Area Rescue Squad; #14 - exerpt from ABC Science; #15 - exerpt regarding exercise increases plasma THC; #16 - Treatise #2, page 1; #17 - Treatise #4, page 1; #18 - Treatise #4, page 1 (different section underlined); #19 - Treatise #4, page 1 (different section underlined), #20 - treatise #5, page 1; #21 - Treatise #4, page 1 (different section underlined), #22 - Treatise #4, page 1 (different section underlined), #23 - Treatise #4, page 1 (different section underlined), #24 - exerpt from ABC science; #25 - Treatise #1, page 9; #26 - squad video (stored in vault - exhibit box); #27 - exerp (blown up) of Professor Ian Mcgregor; #28 - photo of accident scene at a later date and time; #29 - photo of accident scene at a later date and time, #30 - photo of accident scene at a later date and time; #31 - photo of accident scene at a later date and time; #32 - CV of William Johnson; #33 - photo of accident scene on date of accident, #34 - photo of accident scene on date of accident, #35 - photo of accident scene on date of accident, #36 - photo of accident scene on date of accident, #37 - photo of accident scene on date of accident, #38 - Alcohol Influence Report, #39 - Informing the Accused, #40 - Blood/Urone Analysis Report; #41 - Lab Report results, #42 - Lab Results; #43 - Certified Driving Record of defendant; #44 - Wisconsin Motorists Handbook (stored in vault - Exhibit box)

Due to CCAP update, server went down at 6:00 PM. All minutes during the day have been lost and unable to be accessed. For complete details of the days events, a transcript will have to be ordered. 

Re-called, 6:10 PM. Jurors are present with verdict. Court handed verdict, court reads verdict - guilty and also polls jury, all members of jury agree to verdict. Jurors excused, 6:18 PM. Off record, 6:19 PM. Back on the record, 6:21 PM. State asks for judgment on verdict. Court will grant judgment on verdict of jurors. Kennedy - does not object but asks for time to report. State believes its a mandatory report. Court will proceed with sentencing. State - Count 1 - 190 in FC jail, $3264, 30 month revocation of DL, IID - courts discression. Court reviews guidelines. Kennedy makes statement in regards to guidelines, prior offense and asks for time to report for stated reasons on the record. Ufferman makes statement, remorseful. Kennedy calls Susan Ufferman (defendant's wife) makes statement, 6:31 PM. Court sentences the defendant to the following: Count 1 - 190 days in FC jail with huber, $3264 fine, 30 months DL revocation, IID for 1 year - must be installed in any vehicle defendant operates and any vehicle titled or registered in his name and upon issuance of a valid license, AODA and follow through, any safty plan issued by DMV, submit DNA with surcharges. Kenndy asks for credit on revocation, 6 months already suspended. Court - DOT will make that determination. Court advises of appeal rights. Adjourned, 6:44 PM.

Jury trial on June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:42 AM. State - not resolved - asking for a JT at the earliest court date. State - all discovery and offer has been sent as of 3/10/16. Kennedy agrees that the matter is not resolved. Kennedy does not anticipate any motion hearing prior to trial. Kennedy will file witness list within two weeks. Court instructs to contact their witnesses via phone within at least 3 days prior to JT or costs can be assessed and also instructs on jury costs being imposed if resolved day of trial, etc. State requires a plea 7 days before JT, no offer on table, parties will be free to argue. Court will prepare jury instructions, counsel to get copies of any additional jury instructions. Court continues bond, sets for #1 JT but it is backing up an all day court trial.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Called 2:28 PM. State filed has an amended complaint. Defense has copy of complaint and waives further reading and enters NG plea to count 1. Off record for scheduling, 2:29 PM. Back on the record, 2:34 PM. Add bond condition of no consumption of a controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court.  Attorney Robert Kennedy appears in person. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:55 AM. Kennedy files request for subsititon, court accepts, timely, bond continued, will be set for further proceedings when new judge is assigned.

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:34 AM. Court asks where his attorney is and instructs to talk to SPD. Recalled 9:47 a.m. Ufferman is not eligable for SPD and indicates he just can not afford an attorney right now. Court will adjourn to 10/21/15. Court warns if he returns to court without an attorney, bond could be forfeited, a high cash bond could be set, must return with an attorney. Given court appointed paperwork.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

Defendant Scott F Ufferman in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:25 AM. Ufferman has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Ufferman understands charges and penalties, would like an attorney, may be eligible for SPD but will be talking to Attorney Kennedy. Court sets for AIA, gives ramifications of returning without an attorney or contacting SPD or getting forms for court appointed attorney. State - bond - signature bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court - $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:45 am.
